p: Pandemics and other public health emergencies typically lead to a surge in demand for medical care, which overwhelms local capabilities. Telemedicine can be broadly defined as the use of telecommunications technologies to provide medical information and services. The benefits of telemedicine in these situations have been well documented [ 3, 4]. Telemedicine can support long-distance clinical care, education, and health administration, and its use has increased dramatically in the past decade.
